title: How to Make Mistakes in Python
author: Mike Pirnat
description: Even the best programmers make mistakes. In this O’Reilly report, Mike Pirnat dissects some of his most memorable blunders, peeling them back layer-by-layer to reveal just what went wrong.

title: Functional Programming in Python
author: David Mertz
description: In this paper, David Mertz, a director of Python Software Foundation, examines the functional aspects of the language and points out which options work well and which ones you should generally decline.

title: Picking a Python Version: A Manifesto
author: David Mertz
description: This report guides you through the implicit decision tree of choosing what Python version, implementation, and distribution is best suited for you.

title: Python para Desenvolvedores (2nd Edition)
author: Luiz Eduardo Borges
description: [PORTUGUESE] Este livro aborda assuntos que incluem: criação de interfaces com usuário, computação gráfica, aplicações para internet, sistemas distribuídos, entre outros.

title: Intermediate Python
author: Muhammad Yasoob
description: Python is an amazing language with a strong and friendly community of programmers. However, there is a lack of documentation on what to learn after getting the basics of Python down your throat. Through this book I aim to solve this problem. I would give you bits of descriptionrmation about some interesting topics which you can further explore.  The topics which are discussed in this book open up your mind towards some nice corners of Python language. This book is an outcome of my desire to have something like this when I was beginning to learn Python.

title: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Second Interactive Edition
author: B. Miller & D. Ranum
description: This interactive book teaches you Python the interactive way, right in the browser.

title: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist: Learning with Python 2nd Ed.
author: Jeffrey Elkner...
description: This book teaches you Python right in the browser.

title: Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures Using Python
author: B. Miller & D. Ranum
description: This book is a CS2 data structures textbook, with a review of Python concepts in chapter 1

title: Learn Python The Hard Way
author: Zed A. Shaw
description: Have you always wanted to learn how to code but never thought you could? Do you want to challenge your brain in a new way?

title: Dive into Python (2004)
author: Mark Pilgrim
description: Dive Into Python is a free Python book (from 2004) for experienced programmers. It covers many basics of the language

title: Dive into Python 3
author: Mark Pilgrim
description: Dive Into Python 3 covers what's new in Python 3 and how its differs from Python 2.

title: Think Python
author: Allen B. Downey
description: A very exhaustive book covering most of the language features, from datatypes to OOP and debugging.

title: Kivy programming Guide
author: Kivy
description: Discover Kivy the multitouch Python framework for desktop and mobile, and learn how to create a simple game.

title: Django Tutorial
author: Community
description: With this hands-on tutorial, discover Django the popular high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

title: Pyramid for Humans
author: Community
description: With this tutorial, discover Pyramid a Python web application development framework. Its primary goal is to make it easier for a Python developer to create web applications.

title: Flask microframework
author: Armin Ronacher
description: Learn the Flask web microframework by example. Flask aims to keep the core simple but extensible and gives you freedom to choose the libraries of your choice.

title: Making Games with Python and Pygame
author: Al Sweigart
description: Teaches the Pygame 2D graphics library with the source code for 11 games.

title: High Performance Python tutorial
author: Ian Ozsvald
description: In this 55 pages tutorial, Ian Ozsvald shows you a number of techniques to get a 10-500 performance increase in your Python apps, from profiling, to PyPy, numPy, Multiprocessing...

title: A byte of Python
author: Swaroop C H
description: This book aims to help you learn the wonderful Python language and show how to get things done quickly and painlessly - in effect 'The Perfect Anti-venom to your programming problems'.

title: Python 101 - Introduction to Python
author: Dave Kuhlman
description: This document is a syllabus for a first course in Python programming. This course contains an introduction to the Python language, instruction in the important and commonly used features of the language, and practical excercises in the use of those features.

title: The Standard Python Library
author: Fredrik Lundh
description: This book provides a brief description of each module of the +200 Python standard library and usage examples

title: Snake Wrangling for Kids
author: Jason R. Briggs
description: [DOWNLOAD REQUIRED] For children 8 years and older, who would like to learn computer programming. It covers the very basics of programming, and uses the Python programming language to teach the concepts.

title: Programming Computer Vision with Python
author: Jan Erik Solem
description: [PDF DRAFT] This book gives an entry point to hands-on computer vision (images, videos...) with enough understanding of the underlying theory and algorithms.

title: Natural Language Processing with Python
author: S. Bird, E. Klein...
description: Practical introduction to programming for language processing, written by the creators of NLTK.

title: Think Complexity
author: Allen B. Downey
description: This book is about complexity science, data structures and algorithms, intermediate programming in Python, and the philosophy of science.

title: Think Stats
author: Allen B. Downey
description: Think Stats is an introduction to Probability and Statistics for Python programmers.

title: Think Stats 2e
author: Allen B. Downey
description: Think Stats is an introduction to Probability and Statistics for Python programmers.

title: Python Module of the week
author: Doug Hellman
description: The Python Module of the Week series, or PyMOTW, is a tour of the Python standard library through short and concrete examples. It covers more than 50 modules.

title: An introduction to Python
author: John C. Lusth
description: A complete scholar overview of all Python 3 functionnalities from the Alabama University.

title: Building skills in Programming
author: Steven F. Lot
description: How do you learn to program? Through a series of simple exercises that teach programming fundamentals with an easy-to-use, easy-to-learn programming language.

title: Building skills in Python
author: Steven F. Lot
description: This 450+ page book has 42 chapters that will help you build Python programming skills through a series of exercises. This book includes six projects from straight-forward to sophisticated that will help solidify your Python skills.

title: Building skills in OOP
author: Steven F. Lot
description: How do you move from OO programming to OO design? This 301-page book has 49 chapters that will help you build OO design skills through the creation of a moderately complex family of application programs.

title: Python Scientific lecture notes
author: By The Community
description: Teaching material on the scientific Python ecosystem, a quick introduction to central tools and techniques. The different chapters each correspond to a 1 to 2 hours course with increasing level of expertise, from beginner to expert.

title: Programmez avec Python 2
author: Gérard Swinnen
description: [FRENCH] Apprenez à programmer avec Python 2. Découvrez la programmation et le language Python grâce à cet ouvrage de référence.

title: Programmez avec Python 3
author: Gérard Swinnen
description: [FRENCH] Apprenez à programmer avec Python 3. Mise à jour du précédent ouvrage avec les spécificité de Python 3.

title: Python for you and me
author: Kushal Das
description: A book for the total new comers into Python world. Was started as book for students before they read Python tutorial.

title: Python course
author: Patrick Fuchs
description: [FRENCH] Beginner and progressive course about Python theory and concepts

title: Data Structures and Algorithms with Object-Oriented Design Patterns in Python
author: Bruno R. Preiss
description: This book is about the fundamentals of data structures and algorithms. It uses object oriented design patterns and teaches topics like stacks, queues, lists, hashing and graphs. There are also versions for other programming languages.

title: A bit of Python & other things.
author: Jesse Noller
description: A usefull page with good links to read about Python

title: Python Course
author: Google
description: This is a free class for people with a little bit of programming experience who want to learn Python.

title: Porting to Python 3: An in-depth guide
author: Lennart Regebro
description: This book guides you through the process of porting your Python 2 code to Python 3, from choosing a porting strategy to solving your distribution issues. Using plenty of code examples is takes you cross the hurdles and shows you the new Python features.

title: Non-Programmer's Tutorial for Python 3
author: Josh Cogliati and others
description: The Non-Programmers' Tutorial For Python 3 is a tutorial designed to be an introduction to the Python programming language. This guide is for someone with no programming experience.

title: The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Python!
author: Kenneth Reitz
description: This opinionated guide exists to provide both novice and expert Python developers a best-practice handbook to the installation, configuration, and usage of Python on a daily basis.

title: Probabilistic Programming and Bayesian Methods for Hackers: Using Python and PyMC
author: Cam Davidson-Pilon
description: aka 'Bayesian Methods for Hackers': An introduction to Bayesian methods + probabilistic programming in data analysis with a computation/understanding-first, mathematics-second point of view. All in pure Python ;)

title: web2py Complete Manual
author: Massimo Di Pierro
description: As you will learn in the following pages, web2py tries to lower the barrier of entry to web development by focusing on three main goals: ease of use, rapid development and security

title: Cracking Codes with Python
author: Al Sweigart
description: This book features the source code to several ciphers and hacking programs for these ciphers.

title: Modeling Creativity
author: Tom De Smedt
description: Case studies in Python - using the libraries nodebox and pattern the author creates wonderful fractals and descriptiongraphics; python code snippets included

title: Test-Driven Development with Python
author: Harry Percival
description: This book uses a concrete example—the development of a website, from scratch—to teach the TDD metholology, and how it applies to web programming, from the basics of database integration and javascript, going via browser-automation tools like Selenium, to advanced (and trendy) topics like NoSQL, websockets and Async programming.

title: Getting Started with Django
author: Kenneth Love
description: Getting Started with Django (or GSWD) is a series of video-based lessons meant to take you from novice to competent [1], or maybe even beyond.

title: Python 3x Programming (sample)
author: Jody S. Ginther
description: (4 free chapters) Python 3x Programming, Made Fun and Easier by Jody S. Ginther is for the beginning programmer who wants to learn visually and have some fun while learning programming. The full course will take the beginner from ground zero to making their own arcade style game complete with; music, sound, graphics, and how to make a distribution package to share it with your friends in 21 lessons.

title: Djen of Django
author: Agiliq
description: Djen of Django is a book consisting of a series of small Django projects based on small real-world examples. For instance, building a Pastebin, a Blog or a Project Management Application. Djen of Django focuses on teaching the reader Django best practices through the use of real-world examples.

title: Python para todos
author: Raúl González Duque
description: [SPANISH] Libro sobre programación en Python a modo de tutorial, adecuado para todos los niveles de aprendizaje, desde novatos hasta expertos que quieren conocer más sobre Python.

title: Python in Hydrology
author: Sat Kumar Tomer
description: Python in Hydrology is written for learning Python using its applications in hydrology. The book covers the basic applications of hydrology, and also the advanced topic like use of copula.

title: A Programmer's Guide to Data Mining
author: Ron Zacharski
description: A guide to practical data mining, collective intelligence, and building recommendation systems.

title: Invent Your Own Computer Games with Python
author: Al Sweigart
description: Learn to program with the source code for several simple ASCII-art (and later, 2D graphical Pygame) games.

title: Biopython
author: Various authors
description: This is a tutorial and cookbook for Biopython (Biopython is a set of freely available toos for biological computations.

title: Text Processing in Python
author: David Mertz
description: This is an example-driven, hands on tutorial that carefully teaches programmers how to accomplish numerous text processing tasks using Python.

title: How to Tango with Django
author: Leif Azzopardi
description: A beginner's guide to web development with Django 1.7. This book has been designed to get you going fast and to learn by example. You'll learn the key aspects of the Python Django Framework by developing an application called Rango.

title: Python Practice Book
author: Anand Chitipothu.
description: This book is prepared from the training notes of Anand Chitipothu. Anand conducts Python trainings classes on a semi-regular basis in Bangalore, India.

title: Python Cookbook, Third Edition
author: Various authors
description: This book is aimed at more experienced Python programmers who are looking to deepen their understanding of the language and modern programming idioms.

title: Explore Flask
author: Robert Picard.
description: This book is a collection of the best practices for using Flask. There are a lot of pieces to the average Flask application.

title: Django Girls Tutorial
author: Community
description: It's a very beginner-friendly tutorial with introductions to the command line, Python, Django, HTML and CSS.

title: Algorithmic Problem Solving with Python
author: John B. Schneider...
description: Python's syntax and idioms are much easier to learn than those of most other full-featured languages. This book uses programming language Python to introduce folks to programming and algorithmic thinking.

title: Make Games with Python
author: Sean M. Tracey
description: In this book, we are going to learn to make games on the Raspberry Pi with Pygame. We'll look at drawing, animation, keyboard and mouse controls, sound, and physics. This book isn't for absolute programming beginners, but it's not far from it.

title: Automate the Boring Stuff with Python
author: Al Sweigart
description: Learn how to use Python to write programs that do in minutes what would take you hours to do by hand -- no prior programming experience required. Once you've mastered the basics of programming, you'll create Python programs that effortlessly perform useful and impressive feats of automation.

title: High Performance Python
author: Ian Ozsvald
description: By exploring the fundamental theory behind design choices, this practical guide helps you gain a deeper understanding of Python's implementation. You'll learn how to locate performance bottlenecks and significantly speed up your code in high-data-volume programs.

title: Full Stack Python
author: Matt Makai
description: You're knee deep in learning the Python programming language. The syntax is starting to make sense. Now you want to take your knowledge and make something real. This book explains each Python web application stack layer and provides the resources.

title: What You Need to Know about Python
author: Pierluigi Riti
description: The absolute essentials you need to know to get Python up and running

title: Learning Python
author: Fabrizio Romano
description: Learn to code like a professional with Python – an open source, versatile, and powerful programming language

title: What You Need to Know about Machine Learning
author: Gabriel A. Cánepa
description: This book lays the foundation for your work in the world of Machine Learning, providing the basic understanding, knowledge, and skills that you can build on with experience and time

title: Building Machine Learning Systems with Python
author: Willi Richert, Luis Pedro Coelho
description: Expand your Python knowledge and learn all about machine-learning libraries in this user-friendly manual

title: Practical Data Analysis
author: Hector Cuesta
description: Transform, model and visualize your data through hands-on projects, developed in open source tools

title: Raspberry Pi Cookbook for Python Programmers
author: Tim Cox
description: Over 50 tailor-made recipes for programmers to get the most out of Raspberry Pi using Python to unleash its huge potential
cover: python/Raspberry Pi Cookbook for Python Programmers.jpg

title: Annotated Algorithms In Python
author: Massimo Di Pierro
description: This book is assembled from lectures given by the author over a period of 10 years at the School of Computing of DePaul University. The lectures cover multiple classes, including Analysis and Design of Algorithms, Scientific Computing, Monte Carlo Simulations, and Parallel Algorithms.

title: Python for Everybody
author: Charles R. Severance
description: The goal of this book is to provide an descriptionrmatics-oriented introduction to programming. The primary approach taken in this book is using Python to solve data analysis problems common in the world of descriptionrmatics.

title: 20 Python libraries You Aren't Using (But Should)
author: Caleb Hattingh
description: The Python ecosystem is vast and far-reaching in both scope and depth. Starting out in this crazy, open-source forest is daunting, and even with years of experience, it still requires continual effort to keep up-to-date with the best libraries and techniques. This report helps you explore some of the lesser known Python libraries and tools, including third-party modules and several extremely useful tools in the standard library that deserve more attention

title: Advanced Machine Learning with Python
author: John Hearty
description: [registration] Solve challenging data science problems by mastering cutting-edge machine learning techniques in Python

title: Learning OpenCV 3 Computer Vision with Python - Second Edition
author: Joe Minichino, Joseph Howse
description: [registration] Unleash the power of computer vision with Python using OpenCV

title: Learning IPython for Interactive Computing and Data Visualization - Second Edition
author: Cyrille Rossant
description: [registration] Get started with Python for data analysis and numerical computing in the Jupyter notebook

title: Mastering Python
author: Rick van Hattem
description: [registration] Master the art of writing beautiful and powerful Python by using all of the features that Python 3.5 offers
